intro: Corallodendron huillense, commonly known as the Huillén corallodendron, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
